certificate_name: Export fresh or chilled hides and skins of ungulates to the European Union

fields.label: Commodity code
fields.hint: You can use the trade tariff search on GOV.UK to find this. This code is between 4 and 10 digits, for example 0308305000
fields.name: commodity_code

fields.label: Net and gross weight of consignment
fields.hint: Provide the number and the units of measurement. For example, 500 kg (528 kg)
fields.name: commodity_weight

pages.title: What are the details of the product?

content.header: What are the details of the product?
content.caption: Your products
content.paragraph: Provide details of the products in this consignment. You can add up to 5 products to this certificate.

fields.label: Approval number of the manufacturing plant
fields.name: product_approval_num

fields.label: Net weight
fields.hint: Provide the number and the units of measurement.  For example 105.5 kg
fields.name: product_weight

pages.title: What is the place of origin of the consignment?

content.header: What is the place of origin of the consignment?
content.paragraph: Provide details of the name and address of the dispatch establishment
Provide details of the person who will send the consignment, or their representative.

pages.title: How will the consignment be packaged?

content.header: How will the consignment be packaged?
content.paragraph: Enter the person or organisation responsible for the consignment arriving at its destination, for example the exporter or the agent.

fields.label: Total number of packages in the consignment
fields.name: packaged_name

fields.label: Type of packaging
fields.hint: For example Box, Carton, Crate etc.
fields.name: packaged_tel

pages.title: Where will the consignment be loaded?

content.header: Where will the consignment be loaded?
content.paragraph: Provide details of where the consignment will be loaded. This may be the same as the place of origin.

fields.label: Place of loading
fields.hint: Provide the name and location of the establishment
fields.name: loading_location

pages.title: How will the consignment be transported?

content.header: How will the consignment be transported?

fields.label: Expected date of departure from the UK
fields.name: transported_date

fields.label: Means of transport to the BIP
fields.name: transported_method

fields.label: Identification of the transport
fields.hint: Provide the flight number, the ship name or vehicle registration number(s)
fields.name: transported_id

fields.label: Documentary reference number for the transport
fields.hint: For example, number of  the airline bill or bill of lading
fields.name: transported_reference

fields.label: Container and seal numbers
fields.hint: If this is not known at the time of application, leave blank
fields.name: transported_seal

pages.title: Is the final destination of your consignment the EU or a third country?

content.header: Is the final destination of your consignment the EU or a third country?

pages.title: Which Border Inspection Post (BIP) will the consignment arrive at?

content.header: Which Border Inspection Post (BIP) will the consignment arrive at?
content.paragraph: Consignments exported into the EU need to be inspected at a border inspection post, this is likely to be the same location as the first port of entry

fields.label: BIP unit number
fields.hint: You can find this on the European Commissionâ€™s approved list of BIPs
fields.name: bip_unit_num

pages.title: What is the destination third country?

content.header: What is the destination third country?
content.paragraph: If your consignment is destined for a third country, complete this page and the next two pages. If the consignment is destined for the EU, leave this page and the next two pages blank.

fields.label: ISO code of third country
fields.hint: This is the 2 digit code according to the ISO 3166 standard. For example, CN, BY, TY
fields.name: iso_code_third_country

pages.title: For consignments transiting through EU countries, who is responsible for the consignment when in the EU?

content.header: For consignments transiting through EU countries, who is responsible for the consignment when in the EU?
content.paragraph: If your consignment has a final destination of the EU, leave blank.

fields.label: Name, address, post code and telephone number of the person responsible for the consignment in the EU
fields.name: eu_consignment_responsibility

pages.title: Where will the consignment be stored during transit?

content.header: Where will the consignment be stored during transit?
content.paragraph: If your consignment has a final destination of the EU, leave blank.

fields.label: Name, address and post code of the place of storage in the EU
fields.name: transit_storage_address

fields.label: Approval number of the place of storage in the EU
fields.name: transit_storage_num

content.paragraph: Provide details of the person  the consignment will be shipped to, or their representative.

fields.label: Certification region
fields.hint: Select the region in which the certification will take place:
fields.name: certification_place

content.paragraph: If you are the exporter, provide your name or business name. If you are an agent representing someone else, provide their name or business name.

pages.title: What is the origin of the product?

content.header: What is the origin of the product?
content.paragraph: Provide details of the origin of the animals from which the product is derived. These may originate from more than one region. We use this information to help control the spread of disease.

pages.title: What is the planned date of export?

content.header: What is the planned date of export?
content.paragraph: This is the date that the consignment leaves the loading premises  This may not the same date that it leaves the UK.  For block applications, enter the estimated date that the first export is likely to take place.
